triples.name: Temporal logic
triples.relevance: Signal Temporal Logic (STL) is a temporal logic variant used to specify complex multi-agent tasks and behaviors.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Motion planning is the core computational problem being solved for multiple cooperative robots with complex STL specifications.

triples.name: Model predictive control
triples.relevance: MPC is a baseline control method mentioned as limited in scalability compared to the proposed timed waypoint approach.

triples.name: Nonlinear system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses planning for robots with nonlinear dynamics, which require abstraction techniques for scalable planning.

triples.name: Nonholonomic system
triples.relevance: Nonholonomic constraints (like unicycle or car-like dynamics) are explicitly handled in the proposed multi-agent planning method.

triples.name: Integer programming
triples.relevance: Mixed-integer linear programming (MILP) is used to encode the search for waypoints satisfying STL specifications.

triples.name: Collision avoidance system
triples.relevance: Collision avoidance is a guaranteed property when agents follow the synthesized timed waypoints.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Multi-agent coordination and cooperative planning is the fundamental problem addressed in this work.

triples.name: Path planning
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a timed waypoint-based method as a novel approach to scalable path planning for multi-agent systems with STL specifications.
